newsitem.title: USA: General Signal loses two executives in crash.
newsitem.headline: General Signal loses two executives in crash.

text.p: Two executives of the Dielectric Communications Co, a unit of General Signal Corp, were among those who died Tuesday in the crash of two airplanes in Quincy, Ill., said a statement issued Wednesday by General Signal.

James Beville, 50, Dielectric's president, and Mark DeSalle, 43, the company's financial officer, were passengers on the United Express aircraft that collided on a runway with a commuter plane, the statement said.
A company spokeswoman said it's too early to say what the company will do about replacing the executives.

Dielectric is one of 15 business units of General Signal, headquartered in Stamford, Conn. Based in Raymond, Maine, Dielectric, supplies broadcast systems, cable pressurization products, radio frequency custom products and temperature sensing products to major telecommunications companies.
